intro: Catenularia, commonly known as the catenularia vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves that often have a distinctive, serrated edge. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typically white or greenish in color. Catenularia species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
